intro: Hemigraphis dura, commonly known as velvetleaf, is a perennial herb native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its striking, velvety foliage that ranges in color from deep red to purple, often with contrasting leaf veins. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Hemigraphis dura is also valued as an ornamental plant for its aesthetic appeal and ease of cultivation.
